concept.title: Sales Orders
concept.abstract:
The Sales Order (SO) helps manage the Sales Cycle of the products and services offered to customers. The Sales Order can track:
Delivery
Payments
Invoices Additionally, the Sales Order drives customer engagement through the tracking of returns, cancellations, and repeat sales. Analyzing purchase history provides staff users with leveraging capabilites, such as:
Customer Feedback
Target Marketing
Transactional Loyalty The Sales Order defines the customer, products, accounting impact, and payment schedule.

ul.li: Receipt Sales Orders- Journals the receipt of payment at the time of posting. If the receipt does not include an invoice, the receipt will generate a debit to the Deposit Account and a credit to the Revenue or Deferred Revenue Account. Scheduled Sales Orders recorded as a Cash Entry are only made with ePayments.

Invoice Sales Orders- Invoices are created upon closing the Sales Order. When the Sales Order is posted, the GL will reflect a debit to Accounts Receivable and a credit to the Revenue Account. Receipt of payment on an invoiced Sales Order will debit the Deposit Account and credit Accounts Receivable.
